text: Marina Kroschina was a Ukrainian tennis player who played for the Soviet Union and won the 1971 Wimbledon girls' singles championships. ==Life== Marina Kroschina was born on 18 April 1953 in the city of Alma Ata, Kazakhstan in the Soviet Union. Her father was a painter and architect, and her mother, Olga Zobachova, a champion of chess in Uzbekistan and Central Asia. Kroschina committed suicide on 4 July 2000 in Kiev. ==Career== Kroschina won the 1972 European Championship and the All England Plate in 1974. She had some success in the doubles events, winning three titles with Olga Morozova. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1953 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Suicides by jumping in Ukraine Category:Wimbledon junior champions Category:Soviet female tennis players Category:Grand Slam (tennis) champions in girls' singles Category:Universiade medalists in tennis Category:Universiade gold medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Universiade bronze medalists for the Soviet Union
title: Marina Kroschina
